description: This application is used to apply for an Aspida Life Insurance Company Multi-Year Tax-Deferred Guaranteed Annuity (Form Series ICC22C-MYGA1012 / C-MYGA1012). This is a single premium deferred annuity with a guaranteed interest rate for a selected guarantee period (2, 3, 5, or 7 years). Please have personal identification, Social Security numbers, existing contract information (if transferring or exchanging), and financial information available before beginning. Non-resident aliens are not eligible for this product.

pages.title: Owner Information
pages.description: Enter the contract owner's information. For natural person owners, you may also add a joint owner (must be spouse).

questions.label: Type of Ownership
questions.hint: Ask whether the owner is a natural person (individual), a trust, or a corporation/entity. This determines which additional sections need to be completed.

questions.label: First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's legal first name as it appears on government-issued identification. If the owner is a non-natural person (trust or corporation), enter the entity name here.

questions.label: Middle Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's middle name. This is optional.

questions.label: Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's legal last name.

questions.label: Sex
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's sex as it appears on their legal identification.

questions.label: Date of Birth / Formation Date
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's date of birth in MM/DD/YYYY format. For non-natural persons, this is the formation date of the trust or entity.

validation.description: Date cannot be in the future

questions.label: Social Security Number / TIN
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's Social Security Number (for natural persons) or Tax Identification Number (for trusts/corporations). This is required for tax reporting.

validation.description: Must be in format XXX-XX-XXXX
Verify SSN/TIN against owner name and date of birth

questions.label: Marital Status
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's marital status. This is relevant for community property state requirements and spousal consent.

questions.label: Residential Address
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's residential street address. P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed for residential address

questions.label: City
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's city of residence.

questions.label: State
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's state of residence.

questions.label: Zip Code
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's 5-digit zip code.

validation.description: Must be a valid 5-digit or 9-digit zip code

questions.label: Mailing Address (if different than residence)
questions.hint: Ask if the owner's mailing address is different from their residential address. If so, collect it here. Otherwise, skip this field.

questions.label: Phone
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's phone number.

questions.label: Email Address
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's email address.

questions.label: Is the Owner a non-resident alien?
questions.hint: Ask if the owner is a non-resident alien. If yes, they are NOT eligible for this product and the application cannot proceed.

validation.description: Non-resident aliens are not eligible for this product.

questions.label: Is there a Joint Owner?
questions.hint: Ask if there is a joint owner for this contract. The joint owner must be the spouse of the owner.

questions.label: First Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's legal first name.

questions.label: Middle Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's middle name. This is optional.

questions.label: Last Name
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's legal last name.

questions.label: Sex
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's sex as it appears on their legal identification.

questions.label: Date of Birth
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's date of birth.

validation.description: Date of birth cannot be in the future

questions.label: Social Security Number
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's Social Security Number.

validation.description: Must be in format XXX-XX-XXXX

questions.label: Residential Address
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's residential address. P.O. Boxes are not accepted.

validation.description: P.O. Boxes are not allowed

questions.label: Phone
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's phone number.

questions.label: Email Address
questions.hint: Ask for the joint owner's email address.

questions.label: Is the Joint Owner a non-resident alien?
questions.hint: Ask if the joint owner is a non-resident alien. If yes, they are NOT eligible for this product.

validation.description: Non-resident aliens are not eligible for this product.

pages.title: Beneficiary Designation
pages.description: Designate primary and contingent beneficiaries. Primary percentages must total 100%. If naming contingent beneficiaries, those must also total 100%.

questions.label: Decline to designate surviving spouse as sole primary beneficiary
questions.hint: If the owner is married and resides in a community property state (AZ, CA, ID, LA, NM, NV, TX, WA, WI), the spouse is automatically the sole primary beneficiary. Ask if the owner wishes to decline this default and name different beneficiaries. If they are not in a community property state or are not married, skip this question.

questions.label: Beneficiaries
questions.hint: Collect beneficiary information. Ask for at least one primary beneficiary. Percentages for all primary beneficiaries must total 100%. Contingent beneficiaries are optional but if named, their percentages must also total 100%.

options.label: Surviving Spouse (if spouse is Joint Owner)

fields.label: First, Middle, & Last Name (or Entity Name)

validation.description: Must be in format XXX-XX-XXXX
Must be at least 1%
Cannot exceed 100%

groupValidations.description: Contingent beneficiary percentages must total 100% if any contingent beneficiaries are named

pages.title: Product & Funding
pages.description: Select the tax qualification, funding method, premium amount, and guarantee period for this MYGA contract.

questions.label: Plan Type
questions.hint: Ask whether this annuity is Non-Qualified, a Traditional IRA, or a Roth IRA. If IRA, also ask about the contribution year.

questions.label: IRA Contribution Tax Year
questions.hint: Ask whether this IRA contribution is for the current tax year or the prior tax year.

questions.label: How will the Annuity be funded?
questions.hint: Ask how the applicant plans to fund this annuity. They may select multiple methods. Options include new money from checking/savings, ACH/wire, new money transfer, or existing money via 1035 exchange/rollover.

options.label: New Money — Transfer (if agent-initiated, requires 1035 form)

questions.label: Total Single Premium
questions.hint: Ask for the total single premium amount for this annuity contract. This is a single premium annuity — only one premium payment is made.

validation.description: Minimum single premium is $10,000

questions.label: Check if total amount is estimated or a transfer is requested
questions.hint: Ask if the premium amount is estimated (common for 1035 exchanges where the exact value may not yet be known).

questions.label: Initial Guaranteed Period
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to select their guaranteed interest rate period. Options are 2, 3, 5, or 7 years. The guaranteed interest rate is fixed for this entire period.

questions.label: Withdrawal Options
questions.hint: Ask the applicant which withdrawal options they would like. 'None' means no free withdrawals. 'Free Interest Withdrawal' allows withdrawal of credited interest after 30 days. 'Free Withdrawals' allows up to 10% of contract value annually after one year and includes waiver of withdrawal charges for Required Minimum Distributions (RMDs).

options.label: Free Withdrawals (includes Waiver of Withdrawal Charges for any RMD)

questions.label: Number of 1035 Exchange / Rollover / Transfer Sources
questions.hint: Ask how many existing contracts or accounts will be transferred, exchanged, or rolled over into this annuity. One ACORD 951e form is needed per surrendering company.

validation.description: At least one transfer source is required
Maximum 10 transfer sources

questions.label: Special Instructions
questions.hint: Ask if there are any special instructions or notes for this application. This is optional.

pages.title: Financial Profile
pages.description: Provide the applicant's financial profile to support a suitability determination.

questions.label: Federal Income Tax Rate
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's approximate federal income tax rate or bracket.

questions.label: Annual Income
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's individual annual income.

questions.label: Annual Expenses
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's individual annual expenses.

questions.label: Annual Household Income
questions.hint: Ask for total annual household income (all household members).

questions.label: Annual Household Expenses
questions.hint: Ask for total annual household expenses.

questions.label: Liquid Assets
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's total liquid assets (assets that can be readily converted to cash).

questions.label: Net Worth
questions.hint: Ask for the owner's total net worth.

questions.label: Source of Income
questions.hint: Ask for the primary source of the owner's income.

questions.label: Other Source of Income (please explain)
questions.hint: If the source of income is 'Other', ask for an explanation.

questions.hint: Ask if the applicant has emergency funds set aside.

questions.hint: Ask for the estimated amount of emergency funds.

questions.hint: Ask if the applicant currently owns any annuities.

questions.label: Do you currently own any long-term care products?

pages.title: Important Disclosures
pages.description: Review and acknowledge the following required disclosures before this application can be submitted.

disclosures.title: Understanding Your Single Premium Deferred Annuity
disclosures.description: This disclosure explains the terms, benefits, features, charges, and tax guidelines of the Aspida MYGA annuity (Form Series ICC22C-MYGA1012 / C-MYGA1012).

content.body:
## Understanding Your Single Premium Deferred Annuity

This form is not intended to be a complete explanation of the annuity. Only the annuity contract contains all the details. If there is a conflict between this disclosure and that contract, the annuity contract shall take precedence.

### What is an Annuity?
An annuity is a long-term contract between the contract owner and Aspida Life Insurance Company. You give Aspida a sum of money (premium), which accumulates on a tax-deferred basis until you withdraw it or begin receiving payments. It is not meant for short-term financial goals.

### This Annuity
This annuity (Form Series ICC22C-MYGA1012 or C-MYGA1012) is a **single premium** annuity (one premium payment), a **fixed** annuity (earns a guaranteed interest rate), and **deferred** (payouts begin at a future date).

### Free-Look Period
Within **21 days** after receipt (30 days if replacing another contract), you may cancel for any reason and receive a full refund of premium paid.

### Withdrawal Charges
Withdrawal charges apply to full surrenders and partial withdrawals according to the schedule in your contract.

### Tax Treatment
Withdrawals may be subject to federal income tax. A 10% federal penalty tax may apply for withdrawals before age 59½. Consult your tax advisor.

### Important Notes
- This annuity is **not** FDIC, NCUA or NCUSIF insured
- It is **not** guaranteed by any Bank or Credit Union
- It is **not** a deposit, nor insured by any Federal Government Agency
- Neither Aspida nor its agents give legal, tax or accounting advice

acknowledgment.label: I (we) acknowledge that I (we) have read this document and fully understand the information contained in this document. I (we) understand this annuity is a long-term contract with penalties for withdrawals and early surrender, is not FDIC insured, and is not guaranteed by any Bank or Credit Union.
acknowledgment.hint: Read or summarize the SPDA Understanding disclosure to the applicant. Emphasize that this is a long-term contract with withdrawal penalties, it is not FDIC insured, and Aspida provides no legal or tax advice. Ask them to confirm they understand and acknowledge the disclosure.

disclosures.title: Free Look Period Notice
disclosures.description: You have the right to return this annuity contract within a specified period after receipt for a full refund.

content.body:
## Free Look Period Notice

You have the right to return this annuity contract for a **full refund of premium paid** within the free look period following your receipt of the contract.

- **Standard free look period:** 21 days
- **Replacement contracts:** 30 days

To exercise this right, deliver or mail the contract to the agent through whom it was purchased or to:

> Aspida Life Insurance Company  
> 2327 Englert Dr  
> Durham, NC 27713

Upon cancellation, Aspida will return any premium paid and the annuity contract will be void from the Contract Effective Date.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge that I have read and understand the Free Look Period Notice, and that I have the right to return this contract within the applicable period (21 days, or 30 days if replacing another contract) for a full refund.
acknowledgment.hint: Inform the applicant of their right to return this contract within 21 days (30 days for replacements) for a full refund. Ask them to confirm they understand this right.

disclosures.title: Qualified Account Tax Disclosure
disclosures.description: Important considerations when purchasing an annuity for use in an IRA or other qualified plan.

content.body:
## Qualified Account Tax Disclosure

If you are purchasing this annuity contract for use in an **IRA** or other **qualified plan**, you should consider other features of the annuity besides tax deferral as reasons for it being appropriate for your needs, because IRAs and qualified plans already receive tax-deferred treatment under the IRS Code.

All withdrawals and surrenders from a qualified annuity may be fully taxable. Please consult your tax advisor.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge that I understand this annuity is being purchased for a qualified plan that already receives tax-deferred treatment, and that I should consider features other than tax deferral.
acknowledgment.hint: Explain that since this is a qualified plan purchase, it already receives tax deferral, so the applicant should consider other annuity features. Ask for confirmation.

disclosures.title: Important Notice: Replacement of Life Insurance or Annuities (Multi-State)
disclosures.description: This notice applies when the annuity purchase involves discontinuing or changing an existing policy or contract. Required in: AK, AL, AR, AZ, CO, CT, IA, KY, LA, MD, ME, MS, MO, MT, NE, NH, NM, OH, OR, SC, SD, TX, VA, VT, WI, WV.

content.body:
## Important Notice: Replacement of Life Insurance or Annuities

You are contemplating the purchase of an annuity contract. In some cases this purchase may involve discontinuing or changing an existing policy or contract. If so, a **replacement** is occurring.

A **replacement** occurs when a new contract is purchased and you discontinue making premium payments, surrender, forfeit, assign, or otherwise terminate an existing contract.

A **financed purchase** occurs when the purchase involves use of funds obtained from an existing policy to pay premiums on the new one.

### You should carefully consider whether a replacement is in your best interest:
- You will pay new acquisition costs
- There may be surrender costs on your existing contract
- You may be able to modify your existing contract at less cost
- New policies usually take longer to build cash values
- If your health has changed, the new contract could cost more
- Claims on new policies for up to 2 years can be denied based on inaccurate statements

Make sure you know the facts. Contact your existing company for information about the old policy or contract.

acknowledgment.label: I certify that the responses herein are, to the best of my knowledge, accurate. I have reviewed the replacement notice and understand the potential costs and risks of replacing my existing contract.
acknowledgment.hint: Read or summarize the replacement notice. Explain that replacements may involve surrender charges on existing contracts, new acquisition costs, and other considerations. Collect the applicant's signature certifying accuracy of responses.

disclosures.title: Fraud Warning
disclosures.description: State fraud warning applicable to this application.

content.body:
## Fraud Warning

**WARNING:** Any person who knowingly presents a false statement in an application for insurance may be guilty of a criminal offense and subject to penalties under state law. In addition, an insurer may deny insurance benefits if false information materially related to a claim was provided by the applicant.

**For California residents:** Any person who knowingly presents false or fraudulent information to obtain or amend insurance coverage or to make a claim for the payment of a loss is guilty of a crime and may be subject to fines and confinement in state prison.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge and understand the fraud warning above.
acknowledgment.hint: Read the fraud warning to the applicant. Ask them to confirm they understand that knowingly presenting false statements in an insurance application may result in criminal penalties.

disclosures.title: USA PATRIOT Act Customer Information
disclosures.description: Federal law requires financial institutions to obtain, verify, and record identifying information.

content.body:
## USA PATRIOT Act — Customer Information

To help the government fight the funding of terrorism and money laundering activities, Federal law requires all financial institutions to obtain, verify, and record information that identifies each person who opens an account.

**What this means for you:** When you apply for an annuity, we will ask for your name, address, date of birth, and other information that will allow us to identify you. You may be asked to provide your current driver's license, valid passport, or other official identifying document.

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge the USA PATRIOT Act disclosure and understand that Aspida is required to verify my identity.
acknowledgment.hint: Explain the PATRIOT Act requirement that financial institutions must verify customer identity. Ask for acknowledgment.

disclosures.title: New Jersey Regulatory Disclosure
disclosures.description: Specific disclosure required for New Jersey applicants regarding regulatory oversight.

content.body:
## New Jersey Regulatory Disclosure

The solicitation, negotiation, and sale of the annuity applied for, and its suitability, are subject to the regulatory oversight of the **New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance**.

For inquiries or assistance, you may contact:

> Consumer Inquiry and Response Center (CIRC)  
> NJDOBI, P.O. Box 471, Trenton, NJ 08625-0471  
> Phone: (609) 292-7272 or (800) 446-7467  
> Web: http://www.state.nj.us/dobi  
> Fax: (609) 777-0508

acknowledgment.label: I acknowledge that the sale and suitability of this annuity are subject to oversight by the New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance.
acknowledgment.hint: For New Jersey applicants: Inform them that the sale is regulated by the NJ DOBI and provide the contact information. Ask for acknowledgment.

pages.title: Signatures
pages.description: All required signatures for the application, suitability acknowledgment, and disclosure acceptance.

questions.label: I acknowledge that all statements, information and answers given in this application are true and correct to the best of my knowledge. I certify my SSN/TIN is correct. I understand this application is subject to acceptance by the Company.
questions.hint: Ask the applicant to confirm that all information provided is true and correct, their SSN/TIN is correct, and they understand the application is subject to acceptance.

questions.label: Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the owner's signature. If the owner is a trust or corporation, sign in capacity as Trustee or Officer.

questions.label: Signed in State/City
questions.hint: Ask what state and city the owner is signing in.

questions.label: Date Signed
questions.hint: Record today's date as the signing date.

validation.description: Signature date must be today's date

questions.label: Joint Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the joint owner's signature if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Owner Signed in State/City
questions.hint: Ask where the joint owner is signing.

questions.label: Annuitant Signature
questions.hint: Collect the annuitant's signature (for non-natural person ownership).

questions.label: Annuitant Signed in State/City
questions.hint: Ask where the annuitant is signing.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Signature
questions.hint: Collect the joint annuitant's signature if applicable.

questions.label: Joint Annuitant Signed in State/City
questions.hint: Ask where the joint annuitant is signing.

questions.label: Suitability Questionnaire — Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the owner's signature for the suitability questionnaire, acknowledging that all financial information provided is complete and accurate.

questions.label: Suitability Signature Date
questions.hint: Record the suitability questionnaire signing date.

questions.label: Suitability — Joint Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the joint owner's suitability signature if applicable.

questions.label: SPDA Disclosure — Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the owner's signature acknowledging the SPDA disclosure document.

questions.label: SPDA Disclosure — Joint Owner Signature
questions.hint: Collect the joint owner's SPDA disclosure signature if applicable.

pages.title: Agent Certification
pages.description: Agent certification of suitability, relationship with applicant, and commission split.

questions.label: Nature of relationship with applicant(s)
questions.hint: Ask the agent about the nature of their relationship with the applicant.

questions.label: Length of relationship with applicant
questions.hint: Ask the agent how long they have known the applicant (years and/or months).

questions.label: Level of Acquaintance
questions.hint: Ask the agent their level of acquaintance with the applicant.

questions.label: Other products sold to applicant
questions.hint: Ask the agent about other products they have previously sold to this applicant.

questions.label: Reason for recommending this product
questions.hint: Ask the agent to explain their reason for recommending this specific product.

questions.label: I gave the applicant a copy of all sales materials used in the sale
questions.hint: If replacement, confirm the agent provided all sales materials as required by law.

questions.label: I have made a reasonable effort to obtain the applicant's financial information
questions.hint: Agent certification: Confirm reasonable effort was made to obtain financial status and investment objectives.

validation.description: Agent must certify reasonable effort was made

questions.label: I believe this annuity is suitable for the applicant
questions.hint: Agent certification: Confirm belief that the annuity is suitable based on information provided.

validation.description: Agent must certify suitability

questions.label: I believe the applicant does not have diminished capacity for financial decisions
questions.hint: Agent certification: Confirm belief that the applicant has full capacity for financial decision-making.

validation.description: Agent must certify no diminished capacity

questions.label: Commission Option
questions.hint: Select the commission option for this application.

questions.label: Writing Agent(s)
questions.hint: Collect information for each writing agent. At least one agent is required. Up to 4 agents may be listed with commission split percentages totaling 100%.

groupValidations.description: Writing agent commission percentages must total 100%
